text:
The following documentation assumes that the console window will remain open, 
but when working properly, the console window closes immediately without an 
opportunity to enter the commands.  This was using a striclty local console 
installation of Apache.

Controlling Apache in a Console Window
You can tell a running Apache to stop by opening another console window and 
running:

    apache -k shutdown
creator: gallgosp@worldnet.att.net

I don't really understand your comment.  The docs say to "open another console

By this, they mean to open a command prompt (start->run->"cmd").
Then you type the apache -k shutdown at the command prompt.
